name: Dive
description: Dive is a tool for exploring a docker image, layer contents, and discovering ways to shrink the size of your Docker/OCI image.

name: Terragrunt
description: Terragrunt is a thin wrapper that provides extra tools for keeping your configurations DRY, working with multiple Terraform modules, and managing remote state.

name: UPX
description: UPX is a free, secure, portable, extendable, high-performance executable packer for several executable formats.

name: act
description: Act is an open source project that allows you to run your github flow locally.

name: Eget
description: Eget easily install prebuilt binaries from GitHub.

name: Pandoc
description: Pandoc is a Haskell library for converting from one markup format to another, and a command-line tool that uses this library.

name: exa
description: exa is a modern replacement for ls.

name: ripgrep
description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore.

name: fzf
description: fzf is a general-purpose command-line fuzzy finder.

name: fd
description: fd is a simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to 'find'.

name: sv2v (SystemVerilog to Verilog)
description: sv2v converts SystemVerilog (IEEE 1800-2017) to Verilog (IEEE 1364-2005), with an emphasis on supporting synthesizable language constructs.

name: bottom
description: bottom is a customizable cross-platform graphical process/system monitor for the terminal.

name: duf (Disk Usage/Free Utility)
description: duf is a better 'df' alternative.

name: Dufs
description: Dufs is a distinctive utility file server that supports static serving, uploading, searching, accessing control, webdav and more.

name: dua (Disk Usage Analyzer)
description: dua (Disk Usage Analyzer) is a tool to conveniently learn about the usage of disk space of a given directory. It's parallel by default and will max out your SSD, providing relevant information as fast as possible. Optionally delete superfluous data, and do so more quickly than rm.

name: Beehive
description: Beehive is an event and agent system, which allows you to create your own agents that perform automated tasks triggered by events and filters.

name: git-o-matic (gitomatic)
description: gitomatic is a tool to monitor git repositories and automatically pull & push changes.

name: gitty
description: gitty is a smart little CLI helper for git projects, that shows you all the relevant issues, pull requests and changes at a quick glance, right on the command-line.

name: Rclone
description: Rclone ('rsync for cloud storage') is a command-line program to sync files and directories to and from different cloud storage providers.

name: mkcert
description: mkcert is a simple tool for making locally-trusted development certificates.

name: mkcert
description: age is a simple, modern and secure encryption tool (and Go library) with small explicit keys, no config options, and UNIX-style composability.

name: age-keygen
description: age-keygen generate a key pair for use with age.

name: sops
description: sops is an editor of encrypted files that supports YAML, JSON, ENV, INI and BINARY formats and encrypts with AWS KMS, GCP KMS, Azure Key Vault, age, and PGP.

name: kind
description: kind is a tool for running local Kubernetes clusters using Docker container 'nodes'. kind was primarily designed for testing Kubernetes itself, but may be used for local development or CI.

name: bin
description: bin is an effortless binary manager. It manages binary files downloaded from different sources.

name: stew
description: stew is an independent package manager for compiled binaries.

name: hyperfine
description: hyperfine is a command-line benchmarking tool.
